description: A military conflict between the Qing dynasty and the Dzungar Khanate, marked by the Qing's efforts to quell Dzungar uprisings in Qinghai and Mongolia.

1723_campaign.description: Qing army of 230,000 led by Nian Gengyao was initially unable to engage the more mobile Dzungars but eventually defeated them.

1731_campaign.description: A Qing army of 10,000 was annihilated near Khoton Lake, posing a significant threat to Qing control of Mongolia.

1732_campaign.description: A Khalkha ally of the Qing Empire defeated the Dzungars near the Erdene Zuu Monastery, leading to peace and border determination between Qing and the Dzungar Khanate.

political_and_strategic_outcomes.Qinghai_incorporation: Recommended by Nian Gengyao, Kokonor (Qinghai) was incorporated directly under Gansu as part of neidi (interior eighteen provinces).
political_and_strategic_outcomes.peace_agreement: The Qing made peace with the Dzungar Khanate and decided the border between them.

financial_impact.cost_to_treasury: At least eight million silver taels for the 1723 campaign

cultural_notes.Yue_Zhongqi_residence: Lived at the Ji Xiaolan Residence

references.source: History of Civilizations of Central Asia: Development in Contrast: From the Sixteenth to the Mid-Nineteenth Century. UNESCO. 2003
